name: Ti-HEC Panel "Heron"
description: A 7,200 mÂ² array of titanium-alloy substrate panels coated with plasma-sprayed high-emissivity ceramic. The 950 K operating temperature dramatically improves specific rejection per unit area over aluminum OSR panels (Stefan-Boltzmann scales as T^4). The titanium substrate is heavier per square metre than composites, but robust and field-proven. One array handles the waste-heat budget of a mid-range reactor or a reactor paired with an early thermoelectric generator.
